title: Captain Fortune looks more like MF than Classic
body:
See this? This is a pirate hunter. A badass lady that strikes fear in the hearts of even the most ruthless swashbucklers and isn't afraid of taking lives. That's my definition of Miss Fortune.

Her classic skin in comparison looks like a scantily-clad prostitute with a traffic cone perched ontop of her head.

I'm not necessarily appealing for a visual rework or anything considering she just got a TU (and I mainly use the Road Warior MF skin anyway), but it's quite a shame Riot decided to make this new look of Miss Fortune an optional skin for her when, in my opinion, it fulfills the champion's fantasy better than her classic skin does.

Upvote if you feel the same and maybe Rito-senpai will notice us.

--------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE: In case you're familiar with the recent Gangplank changes, I hope you understand that they make my point even more believable. To recap the current thoughts:
Miss Fortune does not look like the badass lady she is because the Classic Skin depicts her in a previous era, a time in which she was still gaining influence and power in Bilgewater and used her 'killer charme' to get things done. At this current point in lore, meaning *right now*, however, she is indeed Captain Fortune and ought to look the part.
Gangplank, now, has recieved a **base model** update, changing his Classic Skin to depict him in the current time, after the events of Burning Tides.

Now I feel like Riot is just taking the piss. Gangplank's new look, post-Dead-Pool, is his base skin, but for Miss Fortune's post-Dead-Pool attire we need to pay? This just doesn't make any sense. Either update them both so their new classic skins are from the same time, that being after their respective events, or you leave them both with their genuine 'Classic' skins and then make skins for the current time in lore. But it makes no sense to just update one to what he would look like now and leave the other hanging in her past!

Both the classic and Captain skins are accurate depictions of Miss Fortune, just at different times in her life. For her career up until this point, classic Miss Fortune suited her perfectly. Its sexy and saucy, just like the facade she upheld perfectly until this pivotal moment. Captain Fortune is her in the moment she killed Gangplank and onwards. There's no longer a strategic need to hide her bloodlust, so her femme fatale persona- including the clothes- is gone.

I think Captain Fortune would have made a good new classic skin to show the transformation and maturation of her character. The previous classic skin could have stayed on as Bounty Hunter Miss Fortune to represent that period of her life, kind of like how Renegade Talon represents the life he spent on the streets before coming to serve General Du Couteau.
She had to disguise herself a "prostitute" while she was gaining influence in Bilgewater. Dressing like you own Bilgewater is an easy way to land on GP's shit list.

But Miss Fortune isn't a sexist joke. She may be sexy, and she may have used her body to her advantage, but she respects her body and expected others to do the same. In lore, she killed a man and took his ship for touching her inappropriately. In game, Her lines include a lot of innuendo, but she isn't complacent and seductive and willing to bed. She's assertive and taunting- She's beautiful, and that makes you less than her.

Form follows function. If you had called Zyra a "sexist joke" I might have understood your feelings. There's no reason for Zyra to be humanoid at all, let alone a sexy woman dressed in leaves. But Miss Fortune has a reason to be both assertive and sexy, and I think that Riot did a good job of designing her with charisma and dynamite as opposed to a redhead bimbo or a courtesan-style manipulator.

I agree that Riot's overall champion designs have been off-point in terms of male and female representation. But Miss Fortune is a good example of when a female champion should be beautiful and should be sexy, and in a positive, empowering way.

Let's not confuse "countering sexism" with "slut shaming".

Let me rephrase tha:. Skins should not be what the champion is supposed to be - and classic MF simply looks like some low-quality porn fanart compared to Captain Fortune. Seriously, it does look neither badass or in any way convincing, it's just "meh, some guy in the art department likes big boobs and apparently sucks at poses and anatomy" - but we are so used to stuff like that in Videogames that we just don't care anymore.
